caption: We called ahead to see if we needed reservation, the woman told us no. Great!  We walk over and wait to be seated. 10 minutes pass and not ONE employee even addressed us. I don't care about long waiting times especially on the weekend, but we literally stood in the doorway as the 2 guys were completely oblivious that we were there, and also a substantial line forming behind us.  Awful customer service which is unfortunate because I heard such good things. Maybe we'll try take out one day, but won't be headed back for dine in service any time soon. Awful!
Excellent service on a very busy day. Didn't order food but everything looked great. Very clean as well
The customer service is consistently speedy, great mood, super nice employees. Will eat here again when I get here.
Very friendly & attentive staff. Must order the pretzel with mustard & cheese! 😋🥨
Great barkeeper John But beers from the fridge (not tap) are by far too warm
Great neighborhood place with lovely patio seating. Even though the menu is limited during Covid they have good options. And of course the fried chicken...
Great place different from the others in The area. Great selection of imported beer.

The atmosphere, service, and drink list here are impeccable.  As soon as I walked in, I  felt like I was  transported to 19th century Germany.  The history here is amazing.  The founder's original passport is in the wall, along with the original menu showing items priced at ten cents.  Also, the ceiling is as old as the building, which is over a century old.  Since there wasn't a huge selection of food on the menu, I ended up ordering the chicken noodle soup (with homemade noodles).  Not bad.  As someone who prefers spicy food, though, I found myself dousing it in salt and pepper.  The wine and beer selections, on the other hand, were extensive and could suit any palate.  As far as service, it was excellent.  My server, Donald, was prompt, courteous, and very knowledgeable about the history of the business.  Other businesses take note!! This is how you should be serving your customers!  This place gets a perfect score for fantastic service, an amazing atmosphere, and an excellent beer and wine selection.  It gets a four star rating for limited food menu choices, as well as some food items coming up short on flavor.  Overall, though, the feel of this place is fun with a very rich tradition,  and would make for an amazingly fun place to socialize with friends.
We got salmon burger and it was so delicious. Price was reasonable.
Great food even if COVID19 has altered their service. I will be back.
Surely a spot worth stopping over, the food is awesome and fresh, the pricing is convenient and it is always clean here. Keep up the good work.
Great bartender original recipe schlitz aleay love this place
Fantastic and flavorful food, I like the character the place has, and the cashiers were very welcoming. I will surely eat here again.
Chill bar, and the Fog on the Hudson was very good
Fantastic place, great service, we were there just for drinks, we ddid not try the food,  but they have a good selection of whiskeys and they made me a pretty good margarita.
One of my preferred places to grab some food. awesome location, clean, and awesome service. Very good job!

Dropped in here for a quick drink just before Christmas. Really glad we did, a great venue. Sat at the bar, friendly and efficient waitress. The beer selection is solid, a great wine selection and a range of top shelf liquor that made me sad to move on. Ordered a few hot snacks, these were good too.  To summarise, a real character venue but one that hasn't forgotten that it is important to serve good drinks and food rather than rely on "character" alone.
I was invited by a good friend. This place is awesome  great food , drinks and service. My waitress was full of life and energy. Love this place.
ok food expensive

One of the worst meals we've ever had. Stopped for brunch at noon on Sunday. Forgot to serve beverage, the Berry waffles looked like 2 Eggo waffles with 15 blueberries on top. No syrup served until asked, nothing else on plate, just 2 underdone pale yellow waffles.Breakfast eggs and english muffin came with no butter or jam. Know they were understaffed but dont bother serving brunch if you cant do it well!

Great little German tavern with spectacular Octoberfest menu so I suggest you hurry in here to enjoy before October passes you by.  I'm so glad I took advantage of the outside seating area last week before the weather here in Chicago cooled off.  Last week I sat outside and tried a rich chicken liver pate, bratwurst with fries and apple strudel decorated with a chocolate rose on the plate! My waiter was very knowledgeable and training a new young waitress while he waited on me and others seated both inside and outside.  Dogs are definitely allowed outside and so a couple brought their dogs along with.  I returned this past Saturday and tried the fully loaded spaetzle which is a trio of three different spaetzle options with various toppings like cheese and bacon.  The potato pancakes I ordered had a great crispy texture but very bland tasting. I asked why they were unsalted and my waitress told me it's for people who have high blood pressure but honestly a pinch of salt, black pepper and a bit of minced garlic and rosemary would have saved this dish from blandness.  The Glunz Tavern has a nice laid back vibe in the early evening and I just came here to eat rather than drink but next time I'll have a sugary beer called a Framboise lambic since I haven't had one in eons. This tavern has a full selection of tavern appetizers, charcuterie and German dishes so it's a wonderful place for a low key bite to eat here in Old Town.
Great wine list, super casual, simple and good food, nice people.
Bad
Less than mediocre German food, and a rather short menu of choices. Such a shame in what could be a really special space.
Decent drink selection. Wait staff is painfully slow. Order your next drink when you're halfway done with your current one if you actually want it after you finish.
Lovely staff but food is okay

Nice place! I like their selection of liquor and they have some great appetizers.  When I was here I didn't I have a drink, but I did enjoy their Italian Flatbread, my friends had the Coconut Shrimp and an appetizer with the smoked sausage.  It was good!!!
Nice restaurant and bar
Good atmosphere; prolly the worst menu/food in the greater Chicago area. 3 stars because our waiter was a total beast.  Best, John
Feels like the type of place where everyone knows your name
Great bratwurst in town
Great wine and bourbon selection!
Very informative and knowledgeable about whiskey, including Irish.
Fried chicken dinner
Great beer/ Mediocre food. The only worthwhile food was the Strudel. All the beers were very good.
Meh...
Rich history

Came here on a Sunday night and it was pretty crowded!  We ordered the meatloaf and the sausages and they were both good! Very filling when you eat them with the mashed potatoes. The beer menu is very big and there is something for everyone! To be honest, I would definitely be down to just come for a drink. Definitely recommend!
Delicious food at a great value!
Classic Chicago watering hole in a great neighborhood.
A few days ago this app glitched and i gave three star that was a error iam happy i was able to change it. Great spot to eat drink and be merry
Great old Chicago feel. Excellent whiskey selection.
Extremely good food with excellent service. Great beer selection!
Great place to go out with friends, very laid back ambiance. Good German beer and foood!

Glunz Tavern is my new favorite spot in Chicago. The restaurant and shop are full of history (it opened in 1888!) and I love the old world feel to it. They serve excellent German food with a great selection of beer, wine, and whisk(e)y. Everything is decently priced and the owner is often there talking with customers. It's a classic gem with good food that's definitely worth going to. Oh, and get the schnitzel!

Amazing german food with great atmosphere and history.  Came on a Thursday (with 1/2 snacks, 4.50 for a giant pretzel and more).  Definitely recommend this as a great place for a drink, a small bite, or a huge dinner.
Good beer, nice schnitzel sandwich, and much less busy than happy camper across the street

Extremely good German food with excellent service. Reminds me of my grandmother's cooking.  Good European beers and a very lengthy wine list. Try the Loaded Spätzel. Great specials on the Tuesday night we visited. Very nice outdoor area.

The food was fantastic. I got the smoked bacon waffle and it filled me up. It was a little sweet but so good. The water and the mimosas were room temperature which left a lot to be desired though. It was good but nothing special, at least for brunch.

WHAT YOU NEED TO KNOW: Fair prices, good service, charming history, wine selection on point.  HONEST ASSESSMENT: I honestly love Glunz. It's my place to sit back and not hurry out. I've been twice in the past month. Both times were to take part in their Wednesday burger deal - $6 for a high quality, juicy burger of the week, then we got a bottle of wine. You know that price is seriously unbeatable... Service has always been so great. It's also one of the oldest buildings in Old Town, so perfect for taking visitors. Don't sleep on their drink selection - and take note - their store next door has legitimately good wine at any price point.
Best drinks in town!
Great food even better cocktails
Great selection of beers, wines and spirits. Very reasonably priced for its location in Old Town. Excellent staff and service - great place to hang out!
Friendly family run and family friendly neighborhood restaurant with bar and adjoining liquor store.

My favorite spot for a laid back drink and quick bite. It's a bar, restaurant and liquor store all rolled into one. Make sure you get the giant German pretzel and check out the cocktails. My favorite is their weekend brunch food

The food and decor of this great place transported me back to Munich Germany. Everything is delicious with traditional flavors in non traditional dishes. Amazing homemade soup,  great drinks good decor, a great place to stop in

Good selection of authentic wursts. Large beer selection with a very reasonable price. The French soup is the clams to fame here, and they don’t come up short.  In addition the staff has always been very friendly and attentive, the 5 or so times I have been. Definitely will return
Good beer selection, great appetizers.
Great bartender. Wonderful drinks.
i like that this place feels well lit, rather than dark and sleepy
Slow service even when there were few customers, and the food was bland.
Overall pretty good. Could use a better beer selection.
Great atmosphere, not too loud. My husband and I could actually have a conversation. Got a pretzel that went well with the beer.
Great staff. 😀
Delicious food. Great owners. Romantic atmosphere. Perfect for date night. A Chicago classic and must go if visiting from out of town. Highly recommend.
I'm always happy to come here. Food and atmosphere is like no other place in Chicago. I love to browse the wine selection. The House of Glunz is part tavarn part wine shop and part restaurant .
Great food, great service!

Had a fabulous bottle of wine and delicious meal at Glunz. It’s such a comforting, local place and their options for meals are wonderful. Had a gnocchi and corned beef dish that was amazing. We had salmon which was perfectly prepared to order. This is what a neighborhood experience should be no matter where you are coming from.

Great beer selection, from American micro brews to European style ales, lagers, and lambics.  Even better, the wine list for by the glass varied, with domestic and imported product.  A historic venue.
Great place, the best staff
A stale inside with condensation from AC dripping on cystomers
Very small portions, overpriced, and not especially good. There's a nice patio, though, the service is attentive, and the building is beautiful and historic.
Wonderful atmosphere and marvelous food at drinks.

The food was straight forward, but remember: German food is not light fare. The service was good and the food was done correctly, tasted good. They have limited vegetarian and gluten free options. I will go back.
Fantastic drink menu and authentic German fare.
Awesome vibe, good for groups or a date.
An AMAZING tavern with a great liquor store in back. Lots of history here and very friendly staff. If you're nice, they may show you some secrets of the tavern, too! ;)
Great laid back vibe in the middle of a less laid back part of town. Very well located too!
Try it!
Love the Grilled Cheese.  Never would have thought of adding a tomatoe.
Great food and drink
Family-owned for generations, beautiful classic bar/restaurant. The Manhattan is perfect, the whiskey selection is impressive, and the German fare is delicious.
Great owner and great atomsphere
Neat spot. We went for a late breakfast and coffee, and our coffee came in a French press.
Beautiful historic building with great bartenders and drink selection.
Naomi was.great!
Great wine and food. Ways can get a table!
Delicious food, great german beer selection, service is okay but not great.
Unpretentious tavern with bar bites and a pool table in the back. It leans more towards dive bar compared to its other Old Town neighbors.
Cool bar with a really large assortment of drinks on tap
Good food but on the expensive side for what it was.  Sever was fun and friendly.   Our kids made us sit outside because of the smells inside.

A friend and I were looking for a bar to watch the Bears game on Sunday but less crowded and we stumbled upon Glunz Tavern. As I debated on hair of the dog, I watched Daren the bartender make a few bloody marys and his attention to detail convinced me to order one. The drink went great with the HUGE pretzel and the eggs benedict my friend and I shared.  I enjoyed this place because the staff was welcoming and the history of the tavern is great. The Glunz Tavern was established in 1888, closed during prohibition for 90 some years and reopened in 2012. The tin ceiling, wooden floors, and bar are the original. There are other tales Daren can share so I won't take all of his stories.  I went back to Glunz for dinner and to my surprise they have live music on Wednesday evenings starting at 7:30 pm. The ambiance, candle light, and music made for an unintended but very nice romantic dinner. We ordered gnocchi without the corned beef, Schnitzel, and pretzel bread pudding. Daren came to the rescue once again. Since they did not have the Chianti Classico I wanted he offered another great red. They have a very wide selection of spirits since The House of Glunz is attached to the tavern and you can just walk over to browse the store.  The Best of Glunz Tavern: -Daren -The history of the tavern -Wide wine and beer selection -pretzel & Schnitzel

I went here for appetizers and drinks before a show. The service was very quick and friendly. My friends and I shared the mussels (so good I had to ask for extra bread to sop up some more white wine sauce), deviled eggs and potato cakes. Everything was delicious! The Tavern is very welcoming and beautifully restored. The ceiling, light fixtures and even the floor looked original. I think the space is great for groups, happy hour and romantic evenings

This is a great winter-time place. It's cozy and dark inside and the food was pretty good, but heavy. Granted I went here in the winter time and I'm sure they change up their menu come summer. I love the history behind the place too!  Their wine store next door is spectacular. The owner is to friendly and knowledgeable about wines.

Simply execellant! From the coctail menu, beer, wine and single malts, there's not much better.  It's casual enough for an easy brunnch after a stroll down Wells or nice enough to walk in after a formel dinner in a tux for that final top off.  Must try the mussles!
Very small  portion sizes and limited menu

Incredible makeover from former rustic liquor store.  Cozy tavern, the bartenders understand how to make a drink, and the few small plates that we tried were great (the cheese selections were fantastic).
